fields.description: Removing from current, and questioning whether this issue is even needed.  The admin gadget has always existed as a portlet, has always been visible to regular admins, contains some useful links for regular admins like create project and users etc, why should it be removed?
fields.summary: Remove Admin Gadget from the dashboard as well as from the gadgets directory
Customise Introduction gadget or replace it with a JIRA Studio Intro gadget
Fix dashboard
Merge the jira-bamboo-plugin applinks support from the branch to the trunk
Make navbar js work again
Fix look-and-feel

fields.description:
This screen is only shown before the bamboo upgrade task that creates a bamboo project for each studio project completes. The upgrade task runs in the background and might take a long time to complete.
There is a spelling error on the screen and the "Creat Me a Plan" link is broken.
fields.summary: Bamboo's initial screen when no plan exists should be hidden

fields.description: There is an upgrade task on bamboo that adds an svn user to crowd. That fails on StAC where we use external crowd.
fields.summary: Adding svn user in bamboo fails on external crowd
NPE in in bamboo when no jira applinks is configured

fields.description:
This class has been promoted to first-level public class.
We need to change the fully qualified class name in initial data and test data.
We may need to write an upgrade task for existing customers.
fields.summary: Fix com.atlassian.sal.jira.scheduling.JiraPluginScheduler$JiraPluginSchedulerService class not found issue

fields.summary: Cannot save Repository information after it's been setup

fields.description:
Studio classes that need constructor injection of this component are:
* StudioEditApplicationProperties
* StudioViewPlugins
fields.summary: Resolve the dependency on ReindexMessageManager, which is not exported by JIRA

fields.description:
Saving an existing plan on Bamboo, while on the Source Repository tab, throws:

com.atlassian.bamboo.security.EncryptionException: Failed to decrypt.
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.security.StringEncrypter.decrypt(StringEncrypter.java:80)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.repository.svn.SvnRepository.validate(SvnRepository.java:695)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.ww2.actions.build.admin.config.ConfigureBuildRepository.validate(ConfigureBuildRepository.java:79)
fields.summary: Saving existing plan in Bamboo throws error

fields.description:
When "Clone an existing build plan" option is selected, Bamboo throws an NPE.

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.ww2.actions.build.admin.create.CreateBuild.doCreateBuild(CreateBuild.java:268)
fields.summary: Clone Existing plan throws error

fields.description:
In order to use Amazon EBS, Bamboo requires pointers to the private key and certificate files associated with the AWS account on the local file system (see bottom of screen shot).  I would like to use the private key and certificates found here (https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/elasticbamboo-dev+account+info) for the demo at ZendCon on Tuesday.

Can you put those on the file system of http://marketing.jira.com and tell me the absolute path to them?  

Thanks!
fields.summary: Need Amazon keys for Studio's Bamboo to use EBS

fields.description:
There is no PHPUnit builder set up in Bamboo, so it is not available as a choice when creating a plan (see screenshot - page shown is http://marketing.jira.com/builds/build/admin/create/addDefaultsForBuilder.action).

Also, no builder display or config option in Adminstration so I was unable to create my own.  Is this by design?

Thanks for your help.
fields.summary: No PHPUnit builder or builder config

fields.description:
This is not a front-end action and should not be written as a Webwork action.
There is a bug in Webwork that in the absence of views, fully-qualified action name is not used to load class.
Currently we get around this by adding dummy views.
fields.summary: Rewrite StudioNavbarInformationAction as a resource handler

fields.description:
Jira 4.0 comes with streams-jira-plugin 3.0.12. 
jira-remote-plugin should be same version.
Probably whole studio should be on streams 3.0.12
fields.summary: Add streams-remote plugin to studio-jira
Replace all ComponentLocator lookup with constructor injections

fields.description:
Currently this action is overwritten in studio because we added "Space Admin" link for Confluence.
However applinks does not export this package
fields.summary: ConfluenceLinkProjectOperation is not exported by applinks-jira

fields.description: Please see AOD-2280 for more details. Thank you
fields.summary: Project source path-based permissions: ability to restrict read access to project sub-paths by groups

fields.description:
Customers are reporting Confluence being inaccessible, displaying the error:


{noformat}You cannot access Confluence at present. Look at the table below to identify the reasons

This page will automatically update every 60 seconds.

Time Level Type Description Exception
2009-11-08 00:47:13 fatal cluster Database is being updated by an instance which is not part of the current cluster. You should check network connections between cluster nodes, especially multicast traffic.
{noformat}

These appear to be cases of [CONF-16989|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-16989].  Creating this issue so we can better track the frequency.
fields.summary: Cluster panic errors

fields.description:
Jira is responsible of migrating old dashboard to new gadget dashboard. There are two possible scenarios 
* Jira Upgrade will run before UpgradeTo_v36 (for new cusotomers)
* Jira Upgrade will run after UpgradeTo_v36 for existing customers.
fields.summary: Fix UpgradeTo_v36 - Streams portlet
replace JiraSession in DefaultStudioHelper with UserProjectHistoryManager
Upgrade task to convert user history using new plugin settings key
Store user history using PluginSettingsFactory api instead of instantiating JiraPluginSettings directly

fields.description: The builds workflow has me as the author, and a last updated date.  As much as I like seeing my name on every Studio instance....
fields.summary: Remove author and date last updated from builds workflow

fields.description: Ordinary users can see the disable remote agents link on the agent administration page.  Let's hide this using CSS.
fields.summary: Hide disable remote agents link

fields.description: We don't use OAuth, and we don't want users seeing it (for now), the web item should be disabled.
fields.summary: Hide OAuth admin menu item

fields.description: The upgrade task does not work in JIRA 4, because GreenHopper for JIRA4, now also a plugins2 plugin, does not export com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.license package.
fields.summary: Update GreenHopper License in upgrade task UpgradeTo_v42

fields.description: User Macros require System Administrator privileges.  We currently do not support adding User Macros ([Restricted Functions in JIRA Studio|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/Restricted+Functions+in+JIRA+Studio#RestrictedFunctionsinJIRAStudio-Confluence]).
fields.summary: Provide User Macro functionality to administrators

fields.description:
We are very much loving the update status feature, but I would love to make this information easier to get to.  Right now I have to click to every developer's profile page to see what their current status.

I would love to have a portal (or some scripting feature in confluence page which could get embedded as a portal component) that shows a groups statii.  This would very much fit our "Kanban" style of development where each person indicates what they are currently working on and we can help spot bottlenecks and work more collaboratively.
fields.summary: Portal to display groups profile status

fields.description:
If someone who receives Studio email notification emails has an autoreply set, these autoreplies get added to JIRA as comments, potentially triggering a mail loop.

To avoid this, we should set the [bulk=ignore field in the mail handler service|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+Issues+and+Comments+from+Email#CreatingIssuesandCommentsfromEmail-handlerparams] in the Studio VM image.
fields.summary: Studio should ignore email autoreplies

fields.description:
Companies that leverage Google Analytics to monitor their sites would like to be able to do the same with OnDemand instances.

 

 
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 4 September 2019}
Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this impacts you and what you're hoping to accomplish with Confluence. We agree that this functionality is very useful for our advanced customers, and we are excited to announce that you can now monitor your Confluence Cloud sites with in-product analytics through Confluence Cloud Premium. 

We believe Premium Analytics will solve the same problem outlined on this ticket in an easy-to-use, integrated Confluence experience. You can find more information about Analytics in the documentation here: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/analytics-972332388.html]

Thank you for your patience and your continued feedback! 

Cheers,

Hilary

Product Manager, Confluence Cloud Team
{panel}
fields.summary: Add Google Analytics hook in OnDemand

fields.description:
Medium to large companies with strict user password policies already implemented in their LDAP cannot developer to join system that do not have similar policies.

Connecting Studio to corp ldap would open the door to many developers that must comply with these policies.
fields.summary: Connect Jira Studio Users to external corporate LDAP

fields.description: JIRA 4.0 has lots of [tasty features|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+4.0+Release+Notes] that Studio customers would like to take advantage of.
fields.summary: Upgrade Studio to JIRA 4

fields.description:
The svn path UI has been updated for 1.8.3 and needs to be redocumented.

see also AOD-1713
fields.summary: Update svn path UI docs

fields.description: Currently WebDAV access is restricted to administrators.  To be able to use it for making backups available to customers, we need to also grant access to another group, eg. 'studio-backups'.
fields.summary: Grant WebDAV access to 'studio-backups' group

fields.description: New Studio instances have Confluence daily backups enabled.  As these are never rotated or deleted they evenually fill up the data partition.
fields.summary: Confluence automatic backups enabled in new Confluence instances

fields.description: This is something to do with the Bambo GlobalAdminDecorator, it can't find resources in the bamboo webapp, freemarkers template loader probably only has a context classloader template loader, it needs a web context template loader.
fields.summary: Auto favourites plugin administration screen has exceptions in header and footer

fields.description:
After the Studio 1.8.2.1 upgrade, a number of hosts' Confluence instances did not load correctly. The most obvious symptom is that the Studio header does not load:

!brokenconf.png!

Also, trying to create a project in Studio fails, and Confluence content presumably doesn't appear in activity streams or searches.
fields.summary: After restart, Confluence sometimes loads without Studio headers or plugins

fields.description:
When clicking on dev.jira.com build > issues tab gets following result.

Method public java.lang.String com.atlassian.studio.bamboo.topnav.StudioPluggableTopNavigation.getHtml(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest) threw an exception when invoked on com.atlassian.studio.bamboo.topnav.StudioPluggableTopNavigation@eddac6 The problematic instruction: ---------- ==> ${ctx.pluggableTopNavigation.getHtml(req)} [on line 2, column 3 in fragments/decorator/header.ftl] in include "/fragments/decorator/header.ftl" [on line 2, column 1 in decorators/buildDecorator.ftl] ---------- Java backtrace for programmers: ---------- freemarker.template.TemplateModelException: Method public java.lang.String com.atlassian.studio.bamboo.topnav.StudioPluggableTopNavigation.getHtml(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest) threw an exception when invoked on com.atlassian.studio.bamboo.topnav.StudioPluggableTopNavigation@eddac6 at freemarker.ext.beans.SimpleMethodModel.exec(SimpleMethodModel.java:130) at freemarker.core.MethodCall._getAsTemplateModel(MethodCall.java:93) at freemarker.core.Expression.getAsTemplateModel(Expression.java:89)
fields.summary: Issues tab in Bamboo throws error and shows stack trace
Upgrade Studio to latest and greatest JIRA 4
UI Requirements for JIRA 4.
Bamboo javascript is not working in studio.

fields.description:
I would like to create a workflow that automatically kicks off code review based on a checkin of a change set by setting the following comment:

PROJECT-1 #comment This fixed this issue, was a typo #review

and furthormore, using #resolve would not resolve the issue. Can only be resolved once reviewed.

This review should include all the code from the checkin even if it spans repositories. (we use a lot of SVN:externals)
fields.summary: Create Code Review Commit Action

fields.description:
When clicking Plans > Bulk Action the menu closes, rather than stay expanded as it does for other sub menu items.
When clicking System > Log Settings the menu closes, rather than stay expanded as it does for other sub menu items.
When clicking Security > OAuth Consumers - it blows away admin navigation on page.
When clicking System > Trusted Applications - it blows away admin navigation on page.
When clicking Auto-Favourite Plugin Configuration - it blows away admin navigation on page.
fields.summary: Bamboo Admin screen behavior faulty

fields.description:

{noformat}500 Server Error

FishEye was unable to process your request.
java.lang.IllegalStateException

The effective user stack is already empty
{noformat}

!feerror.png!

There is an authentication error in logs

fields.summary: EC2 agent is unable to check out the source from SVN

fields.description:
We are updating the Terms of Use document to accommodate the EC2 use, and will need users to agree to the Terms of Use as part of beginning Bamboo setup in Studio.

'I have read and agreed to the [Terms of Use|http://www.atlassian.com/hosted/terms.jsp] for Atlassian Hosted Services.'
fields.summary: add click-thru to bamboo setup

fields.description: Currently bamboo defaults to file:// url
fields.summary: Make sure bamboo plans use public svn url
Create new bamboo release

fields.description: The project, history, etc drop downs don't work when on the build tab.
fields.summary: Drop down menus don't work on Bamboo pages

fields.description:
Given a Subversion commit comment:

bq. ABC-1 #comment code corrected as per review comments CR-ABC-10 #resolve

The commit log parser mistakenly identifies ABC-10 as the issue reference.

This can be seen with a simple test: "CR-ABC-1234 #comment Blahblah" will trigger an email error "Issue not found: ABC-1234".
fields.summary: Commit message actions mistake Crucible review keys for issue keys

fields.description: At some stage we need to upgrade Crucible, if only to pick up the various bugfixes made since 1.6.6, such as [CRUC-880|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CRUC-880].
fields.summary: Upgrade FE/Crucible to 2.x

fields.description:
Currently we are shipping with version 1.1.78

Version 1.6.32 is now available, so it would be good to update to a newer version - some features were added in 1.5 that customers want.
fields.summary: Upgrade bundled Balsamic plugin for Confluence

fields.description: I tried to start up Bamboo at dev.jira.com and found out, that bamboo is not set up. The home directory is empty, there are no initial data, database settings, license, etc.
fields.summary: Set up initial data for Bamboo deployments

fields.description: Cannot make inline comments on streams on FF or IE on Windows.
fields.summary: Inline commenting on Streams broken

fields.description: Upgrade Studio's SVN 1.6
fields.summary: Upgrade Studio's SVN 1.6

fields.description:
We need to either
* update fisheye classloader to be able to load studio.default.properties 
* modify studio maven to include studio.default.properties in separate jar and place in {{/lib}} folder
* change DefaultThemeProperties to load the file from working direcotory
fields.summary: Fisheye is unable to load studio.default.properties

fields.description: Bundled Gliffy is old - v1.4. Its now above 2.0, which fixes some licensing issues as well as other improvements.
fields.summary: Upgrade Gliffy to v2.+

fields.description:
Currently this page states: 

* http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=169120563

{quote}Alternatively, if you can arrange for emails to be redirected to the jira@yourcompany.jira.com mailbox preserving their From: address, then we can reuse this for new issues as well as comments.{quote}

The problem is that we can only set up one project to create issues and (as I just found out) the procmail rules filter out anything that doesn't have [JIRA Studio] in the subject. So its basically useless to the customer for anything other than the default comment service. 

I think it would be better if we forced the customers to provide us with a POP/IMAP inbox. Its better for us, and its better for the customer as they can manage their own spam filtering rules etc.
fields.summary: Remove that we can create issues from email using jira@yourcompany.jira.com email address from documents

fields.description:
I would really like to see some sort of tagging facility for projects. My initial suggestion would be to extend the Project categories so a project could have several categories. This would resemble tagging more as we know it from e.g. iPhoto, twitter, delicious etc. (I have mentioned this is a previous issue).

Examples could be:

prototype, web application, perl

plugin, javascript, open source

and so forth
fields.summary: Multiple project categories for projects (tagging)

fields.description:
I have plenty of small projects so I like the project categories and would love to see this feature extended further. 

I would love if would be possible to create filters for Dashboards etc. by project categories instead of filters or single projects. This would resemble tagging more as we know it from e.g. iPhoto, twitter, delicious etc.
fields.summary: Filters based on Project Categories

fields.description: When creating a personal space in 1.8.2, there are three templates to choose from, but the "Default Theme" and "Studio Theme" are essentially the same.  We should remove Default Theme from selection.
fields.summary: Remove Default Theme from selector in Personal Space creator

fields.description: Investigate
fields.summary: Jira is not trusting Fisheye on dev.jira.com
In user dropdown menu group "Personal Space" and "Profile"  together

fields.description:
* in jira status update doesn't display last status
* in fisheye you get "You are not logged in. Log in here and try again" message and updating status doesn't work.
fields.summary: Status update problems

fields.description: right now there's a rule between profile and personal space, and administration and profile are grouped together. lets move the rule down so that profile and personal space are grouped together, and administration is by itself.
fields.summary: change location of horizontal rule in username dropdown

fields.description:
can we use a quotation marks icon in Streams for status updates instead of the wiki icon (look at the icon used in Confluence)

can we put the word 'is' (non-linked) between username and status?

non-blocker for 1.8.2 - can go into 1.8.3
fields.summary: updates to Status in Stream

fields.description:
When performing a workflow migration, JIRA says:

bq. Note: You are about to begin a process that will change every issue in project XYZ. This process can take a long time, and therefore it is advisable to perform this operation when the system is under low load. Please ensure that you have a backup of your data before proceeding. If the process fails or JIRA is shutdown before the process completes, you can attempt to associate the workflow scheme wfs2 with project B Project again. If the process fails again, please restore from backup to ensure that issues in the project remain in a consistent state.

Although this warning won't apply to most Studio customers with small JIRA instances, we have a few larger instances, and to use JIRA safely here requires being able to perform backups.  We should have an interface for (at least) triggering an XML backup in a hardcoded directory.
fields.summary: Need an interface for triggering a JIRA backup and restore

fields.description:
One of our customer would like take advantage of this feature and use it in the standalone JIRA.

Maybe we could publish the code as an unsupported plugin?
fields.summary: create plugin from 'Actioning Issues via Commit Messages' feature

fields.description:
Pull down menus don't work on Greenhopper pages.
Side nav menus on admin screens don't expand when title clicked
Side nav menus on admin screens don't stay expanded when sub nav items are selected
fields.summary: JQuery version causing issues

fields.description: http://dev.jira.com/secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa admin nav bar is the Issues admin side nav, not the general admin side nav.
fields.summary: Wrong side navigation on Global Admin page

fields.description: there is also javascript error: jQuery(document).ready() Type error
fields.summary: Dropdown menus do not work in Jira on webkit browsers

fields.description: Running the [Confluence LaTeX plugin|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/LaTeX+Plugin] requires having LaTeX installed on the server.
fields.summary: Add LaTeX packages to Studio VM

fields.description: For ease of use by the dev team, I'd like to have a way to enter only time remaining on tasks without being required to enter time spent.  Burndown charts don't care about time spent; only time remaining so I don't want to burden developers with having to enter more than is needed.
fields.summary: Time remaing shouldn't need time spent entry

fields.description:
We have created a custom field called "account contact email" to hold the email address for a customer reporting an issue.  Within the notification scheme we want to send an email to this email address when the issue is created and on specific transitions.  On adding this option to the notification scheme we are allowed to select the user custom field value but the drop down selection list is empty.

Is this a bug or is there something we do not have currently set up within the system?
fields.summary: Unable to send a notification to a customer email address

fields.description:
Especially if the JIRA development team considers implementation of the feature request http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-18777 to allow users to watch JIRA projects for updates, it would be extremely intuitive and user-friendly to provide one unified interface in which a user can:

* watch any project for all changes (meaning being notified of new and updated Confluence, JIRA, FishEye and Crucible artifacts).

* watch any project for specific changes (meaning the user can choose amongst Confluence, JIRA, FishEye or Crucible notifications).

If a Confluence space doesn't have an associated JIRA project or SVN repository, then obviously options to watch for changes to JIRA, FishEye and Crucible would not be presented.
fields.summary: Provide an integrated user interface in which a user can watch any or all types of changes to a project

fields.description:
The JIRA colours are different to the Studio colour, so it would be expected that the colour scheme would revert back to what they first saw logging into studio, not something completely different. 

The default colours are stored in {{$JIRA_HOME/WEB-INF/classes/jira-application.properties}}. If its possible to ship a studio specific version of this file containing the studio L&F then resetting the defaults would work as expected.
fields.summary: When editing look and feel, "Reset Defaults" should default to the studio colours, not the standard JIRA colours
Studio Static resources plugin got disabled in confluence

fields.description:
If you have an issue like this:
/browse/PT-69

and you go to the manage attachments version of it:

/secure/ManageAttachments.jspa?id=12619

The links for Components and Fix For intermittently omit the project key as part of the URL.  I sometimes will see it there when I first load the page, but if you hit reload, they disappear.

You end up with a link like this:

/browse//fixforversion/10154

note the lack of the project key in this URL.
fields.summary: Links to versions on issue manage attachments is broken
Create new Bamboo project for existing JIRA projects

fields.description:
By default, there is no security in running Bamboo remote agents.
* hide screens that inform about remote agents
* bind active mq to localhost
* investigate option of disabling remote agents but allow only EC2 ones.
fields.summary: Disable remote agents on bamboo

fields.description: When creating a new build plan, there is a screen that expects details about fisheye instance. Hide those fields and fill them automatically from applinks.
fields.summary: Bamboo-fisheye integration

fields.description:
Bamboo has internal integration with Jira that is using it's own configuration. 
We should change it to either use applinks, or we should update that configuration somehow with details from applinks.
fields.summary: Bamboo-Jira plugin changes

fields.description: Jira should use latest version of jira-bamboo-plugin (one that eric changed to use applinks)
fields.summary: Jira-bamboo-plugin upgrade

fields.description:
- Dashboard screen - to include projects with no plans
- Project screen - add the link - "Add the plan to this project"
- Bamboo landing screen - see [Bamboo Landing Page|https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/HS/Bamboo+Landing+Page]
fields.summary: Implement new Bamboo screens
Restricted Bamboo Admin

fields.description:
Hi.

I'm working with an evaluator who had some questions I didn't know the answers to.  They are interested in learning more about the details of importing their current Trac issues into Studio once they subscribe.

- What happens with users, and how is the association between Studio users and imported issues established?
- Are Trac attachments supported? comments?
- How are Trac fields mapped to Studio JIRA?
- They currently have a custom field in Trac that would logically be a Status in JIRA - are mappings such as this possible?

Thanks for your help.
fields.summary: Questions on Trac Import

fields.description: By default Studio's JIRA will create comments from emails.  Many customer's emails have a signature or disclaimer, and they would like to have this signature stripped before the email becomes a comment.
fields.summary: Provide interface to configure stripping signatures from incoming email

fields.description: [Source|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/Working+with+Source] and [Reviews|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/Working+with+Reviews] pages link to current docs for FishEye and Crucible rather than 1.6 docs, which can be confusing to customers.
fields.summary: Source and Review Docs link to FE/Cru 2.0
Implement upgrade tasks for creating Bamboo SVN user

fields.description:
This will be done in JIRA:
Including:
* password change period in days (maximum unchanged password days)
* maximum invalid password attempts
* password history count (must be at least 1 to really force password change)
* password strength (password regex)

Instead of having to ask users to enter a regex for the password strength, we can provide the following fields and create the regex accordingly:
* minimum length
* min number of alpha
* min number of num
* min number of special characters
fields.summary: Provide password rules admin UI
Force password across apps

fields.description:
Hide most of the links, especially all left-hand-side menu.
Hide tabs to other apps.
Provide initial message to inform users their password has to be changed.
Redirect to the original url when password is changed successfully.
fields.summary: Modify change password page for forced password change
Force password change at login in Confluence
Force password change at login in JIRA

fields.description: Renaming Jira studio studio project will rename it only in Jira. The space name in confluence, and project name in Bamboo keeps the old names.
